headline: UBS hikes its Corning Inc price target on AI data center fiber-optic cables demand
summary: Investing.com – UBS has aggressively raised its Corning Inc (NYSE: GLW) price target to $160 from $125 and maintained a buy rating on the stock. The aggressive move was driven by the massive wave of capital expenditure (capex) revision from leading data center hyperscalers. The analysts noted that Corning glass was set to benefit from the AI infrastructure buildout due to rising demand for fiber optic cables.
